author: Joel M. Cohen

review: I WANTED to love this streaming stick.  At first, I thought to myself, "Yay, I'll get one of these for EVERY room in my house!  What a great solution!"  Alas, I am on Day 2 of fiddling with this thing and I want to throw it out the window.  I've even tested my streaming speed and contacted my ISP to deal with the issue. I am streaming on my laptop at around 33 Mbps.  Every OTHER device in my household works great with streaming but this stick is slowly killing me.The main reason I purchased the stick was to stream my Amazon Prime shows directly through my TV.  I was tired of watching via laptop.  And when I set it up, I was thrilled at how easy it was!  Look!  There is even a button for Amazon Prime on my remote!Yes, it has amazing channel selection.  Yes, the first appearances are fabulous.  Roku Streaming Stick, I WANTED to love you.But they shouldn't call it a streaming stick.  They should call it a trickle stick. It simple will not play for very long.  It's currently connected to a TV that sits RIGHT NEXT to my router.  I continue to get error messages about my "slow internet connection."  Sitting on the screen right now is a message that says "We're unable to play your video right now.  Please try again in a few minutes or contact Amazon.com customer service." (That's my next step right after I warn people away from purchasing this product).  It is a maddening way to live life.  The few shows I have watched have taken almost twice as long to view because I can't view them from beginning to end.And, at first, I loved the remote.  Now, I can't even tell if it's working.  There's no light on the bottom and it doesn't seem to respond every time.  I push a button.  Nothing happens.  I even already replaced the batteries (they were good quality Duracell, so I couldn't imagine that was the problem, but I'm trying everything!)  Then, out of the blue, it will start responding again.This is my first Roku purchase. All signs point to it being my last.
author: KTily

review: Works very well and I am happy with the unit, price and performance. Both Roku and Apple TV and other streaming devices would be better however if the included a volume control on their remotes. Not having this capability means you always need two remotes to adjust the total viewing/listening environment.
author: K. weber "the engineer"

review: Both the app and Roku stick crash ALL THE TIME!  I can't go 30 seconds navigating content without one of these things rebooting. Incredibly frustrating and total was of time. I doubt any real testing was done on this thing and the consumer gets to beta test this insanely buggy product. Returning it today!
author: Marcio F. Dacosta "Marcio"
